catalog.message: XML is a Extensible Markup Language that you can use to create your own tags. It is a flexible text format for creating structured data documents. It was designed to transport and store data by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). This document is my wish list textbook catalog.

textBook.title: Beginning XML: Edition 5
textBook.author: Joe Fawcett, Danny Ayers & Liam R. E. Quin
textBook.description: A complete update covering the many advances to the XML language

textBook.title: Beginning XML with C# 2008
textBook.author: Bipin Joshi
textBook.description: Beginning XML with C# focuses on XML and how it is used within .NET 3.5.

textBook.title: XML Development with Apache Tools
textBook.author: Theodore W. Leung
textBook.description: This book is a code-intensive guide to the Apache XML tools that are most relevant for Java developers.

textBook.title: XML: A Desktop Quick Reference, Edition 3
textBook.author: Elliotte Rusty HaroldW. Scott Means
textBook.description: Quick-reference syntax rules and usage examples for the core XML technologies, including XML, DTDs, Xpath, XSLT, SAX, and DOM
